channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California fire victims say fighting with insurance companies has delayed rebuilding
item.description: Wildfires last January destroyed communities around Los Angeles. Homeowners say recovery has been slowed by fights with insurers to get their claims p...

item.title: The EPA is changing how it considers the costs and benefits of air pollution rules
item.description: The EPA won't consider the economic costs of harms to human health, at least for now. Legal and health experts are concerned that the change could mak...

item.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
item.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes abou...

item.title: As Iran's protests continue, Israelis and Palestinians watch closely
item.description: There is broad support for the protests among Israeli officials, but Palestinians say they hope the Iranian regime stays in place and the protests die...

item.title: Minnesota sues over Trump's ICE enforcement. And, SCOTUS hears trans athlete cases
item.description: Minnesota officials sued the Trump administration over unconstitutional ICE conduct. And, SCOTUS hears two cases on whether states can bar transgender...

item.title: Mother of one of Elon Musk's kids says AI chatbot Grok generated sexual deepfake images of her
item.description: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok is facing intense criticism, accused of allowing X users to generate sexually explicit images of real women and children. ...

item.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon
item.description: Yoon is accused of leading an insurrection when he tried to impose martial law in 2024.

item.title: CPI rose at 2.7% annual rate in December as inflation remains sticky
item.description: Although there are signs that inflation is starting to ease, consumers still face pressures from high food prices and other costs.

item.title: World central bank chiefs 'stand in solidarity' with US Fed chair Powell
item.description: Eleven central banks have backed Jerome Powell after the US launched a criminal investigation into the US Fed.

item.title: US carbon pollution rose in 2025. Experts blame cold winter, high natural gas prices, data centers
Senator Mark Kelly sues Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth over attempted demotion
item.description: The US senator and former Navy captain is contesting a move to review his retirement grade after he criticised the Trump administration.

item.title: Tensions flare in Minnesota as protesters and federal agents repeatedly square off
item.description: Days of demonstrations against immigration agents and a new lawsuit have left Minnesota tense. Federal authorities used tear gas on Monday to break up...

item.title: Le Pen hopeful appeal will allow her to run for French president
item.description: An appeal by France's far-right leader begins against a ruling banning her from running for public office for five years.

item.title: Which countries do business with Iran and what could US tariffs mean?
item.description: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran after its deadly crackdown on anti-government protests.

item.title: Clintons won't testify in Epstein probe as House Oversight GOP threatens contempt
item.description: Republican Rep. James Comer of Kentucky, the committee's chairman, said the panel will move next week on holding them in contempt.

item.title: Listen Live: Supreme Court hears arguments over transgender athlete bans
item.description: The Supreme Court is hearing two cases involving laws from Idaho and West Virginia that ban transgender athletes from participating in girls' and wome...

item.title: MoneyWatch price tracker shows how much food, utility, housing costs are rising
item.description: These charts track prices consumers pay for groceries and other goods now compared to five years ago.

item.title: New video shows the minutes before immigration officer fatally shoots woman in Minneapolis
